Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> if you mean:

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> using a wallet on a forked chain, then that is like using a different room

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> and if you then take that wallet back online to the main chain, any entries made to it from the other forked chain, will just not exist and be removed/replaced with the main chain consensus entries that occurred during that time

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> What I mean is how can using the old wallet cause a fork or (leaving to another room as you were saying)?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> using an old wallet doesn't cause a fork

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> I thought you said we need to update our wallets so we are not on a forked chain

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> what's the difference in 'forking away and 'causing a fork'?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> it would occur for other reasons like an attacker taking advantage of the security issue that was fixed

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> Yes

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> That's why this is a critical update, it addresses an issue

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> Right, v0.5.5 fixes the issue from prior versions (5.0 - 5.4)

Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> So much of the tech of blockchain is really simple, but the "tech" layer makes it hard to understand a lot of time

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> how does staking fit into your room full of people analogy ?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> Right now I'm contribute by helping with communications and am doing some coding on a couple cool things which I'll share soon

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> oh, that's cool what kind of resources do you use for the communications?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> So that's another layer, coinbases, in the simple example everyone is just exchanging tokens...the coinbase is where the supply of coins originates, so people have tokens/coins to exchange with each other

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> staking and mining are like "jobs" that let you get paid from the coinbase

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> What is the metaphor for layer? floor room?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> but the coinbase isn't a person, it's another algorithm driven function, and spits out coins if you solve a puzzle

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> it's sort of like a game really

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> üòÉ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> Idk

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> So everyone comes into the room and there's this shiny cool, maybe ancient-looking, box, we'll call it a "box of truth"

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <GlorymanRTS> maybe staking means that the people in the original room are forced to stay in the room and piss their pants!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> and for mining, it's a really hard problem to solve and each works super hard to figure it out before someone else.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdvrsc] <John Westbrook> if it's getting too difficult for anyone in the room, difficulty can drop so it takes only a minute to solve

Author: Gateway#3763
